poem:
"Ode to the Theatrical High"

Easy is the fast-paced river,  
Breaching banks, this tide of gold.  
West End plays our purses shiver -  
£300 seats, audacious, bold.

Cabaret, oh regal mistress,
Musical of lavish spree.
Nestled in your velvet chest is  
Costly melody's decree.

Note by note, we pay the piper, 
Still, the heart does dance and flutter,
In gallant dreams, the stage lights brighter,
In the hush of velvet utter.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Top-price West End theatre tickets rise by 9% in a year and reach £300 Top-price theatre tickets in the West End of London have risen by more than 9% in a year, with the musical Cabaret offering the costliest seat at £303.95. Research published on Thursday by industry newspaper the Stage for its annual ticketing survey found that the average top-priced West End ticket was £154.56, compared with £141.37 in 2023. Cabaret had the highest". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
